indiedev package¶

Submodules¶

indiedev.app module¶

indiedev.app.run(awake=None, update=None, inputs=None) → None¶

Create a new screen.

Parameters:

Awake(function name)

this is called once before a screen loop starts

Update (function name)

this takes a function and calls after refreshing the screen

:input(function name) : this is called before the update

Mouse(x,y)

class indiedev.colour.COLOUR¶

Bases: object

Make a colour using RGB values

Aqua = (0, 255, 255)¶
Black = (0, 0, 0)¶
Blue = (0, 0, 255)¶
Fuchsia = (255, 0, 255)¶
Gray = (128, 128, 128)¶
Green = (0, 128, 0)¶
Lime = (0, 255, 0)¶
Maroon = (128, 0, 0)¶
Navy = (0, 0, 128)¶
Olive = (128, 128, 0)¶
Purple = (128, 0, 128)¶
Red = (255, 0, 0)¶
Silver = (192, 192, 192)¶
Teal = (0, 128, 128)¶
White = (255, 255, 255)¶
Yellow = (255, 255, 0)¶
make(R, G, B) → None¶

Make a new Colour with the help of RGB values

Parameters:

R: Red(int) range(0,255)

G: Green(int) range(0,255)

B: BLUE(int) range(0,255)

indiedev.colour.clamp(value, min, max)¶

indiedev.files module¶

class indiedev.files.FILE(name: str = 'data')¶

Bases: object

File module allows us to store data on json format.

This can be easily accessibe for the users.

(It uses a dictionary to store which is converted to json object)

delete(key)¶

Delete the data after use

:Parameters

Key

the key and value you want to delete.

get(key)¶

Get a previously stored value from the file

:Parameters

Key

the key which holds the required data

:Returns

Value

the data contained by the key

save(key, value)¶

Save the required data with its key

Parameters:

Key

the key holds the value

Value

the actual data to be stored

indiedev.physics module¶

indiedev.physics.collision_test(object)¶

Detects collision for the given object with the map colliders

indiedev.physics.move(object: pygame.Rect, movement)¶
Object(pygame.Rect)

the object which is moving/wants to move

Movement[x,y]

the amount of pixels it want to move per frame

Tiles[(Rect1),(Rect2),…]

possible tiles it can collide with

indiedev.sound_manager module¶

class indiedev.sound_manager.MUSIC(path: str)¶

Bases: indiedev.gameobject.GAMEOBJECT

Manages the background music

fadeout()¶
path = ''¶
pause()¶
play(loops: int = - 1, start: float = 0.0, fade_ms: int = 10)¶

Play music (background music) Parameters: :loops(int): how many times to loop the the music, -1 for infite loops :start(float): from which position of the time to start playing :fade_ms(int): the duration required to fade in

stop()¶
unpause()¶
volume(volume: float)¶

Set the volume of the music Parameters: volume(float): range from 0 to 1

indiedev.spritesheet module¶

class indiedev.spritesheet.SPRITESHEET(filename)¶

Bases: indiedev.image.IMAGE

Use spritesheets to better performance.

image_at(rectangle, colorkey: Optional[indiedev.colour.COLOUR] = None) → indiedev.image.IMAGE¶

Load image from the sheet

Parameters:

Rectangle(x,y,x+offset,y+offset)

the dimentions of the image

:colorkey(COLOUR):colourkey for that specific image

Returns:

An individual image

images_at(rects, colorkey: Optional[indiedev.colour.COLOUR] = None)¶

Loads multiple images, supply a list of coordinates

Parameters:

Rects([rect1,rect2,…,rectN])

list of rects as per (x,y,x+offset,y+offset)

:colorkey(COLOUR)

Returns:

List of images(IMAGE object)

load_set(x: int, y: int, grid_size: int, colorkey: Optional[indiedev.colour.COLOUR] = None)¶

Loads a set of given size and amount

Parameters:

X(int)

the starting position of the cropping grid(x)

Y(int)

the starting position of the cropping grid(y)

Grid_size(int)

size of an individual tile

Returns:

List of images(IMAGE object)

load_strip(rect, image_count, colorkey=None)¶

Loads a strip(horizontal) of images and returns them as a list

indiedev.spritestrip_animation module¶

class indiedev.spritestrip_animation.SPRITESTRIP_ANIMATION(filename, rect, count, colorkey=None, loop=False, frames=1)¶

Bases: indiedev.image.IMAGE

sprite strip animator

This class provides an iterator (iter() and next() methods), and a

__add__() method for joining strips which comes in handy when a

strip wraps to the next row.

iter()¶

Iterate through the animation once

next()¶

Bring up the next frame of the animation
